name: **Wherroon Island – _Na Fioriúin_**
description: Wherroon Island – Na Fioriúin L732-302 Sheet 44 This islet has a huge LW footprint, but largely disappears at HW. It may even be awash at higher HWSs, notwithstanding which it supports a colony of mixed Arctic and Common Tern. It has two high points, rocky in the SW and a peculiar conical stormbeach in the NE, the only 360Ostormbeach in Ireland that I know of. All else is awash above HWN. Land easiest at the foot of the stormbeach in the NE.
